intro: Symphytum podcumicum, commonly known as the Armenian poppy, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It features showy, bright red to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a robust root system and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
